Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> The problem is that such bugs don't seem to interest anyone in the mainstream. Every day we hear about how bad Facebook and others deal with our data and what they do with it. But even in my lessons I notice that even young people are hardly interested in what happens to their data. Why should it be any different in the Cryptoworld? Everybody thinks "Private Coins" are the future...but to question why? No, I'd rather take the next hype with me...slowly it's getting boring. I find nowhere is the discrepancy between actual achieved and marketing BlaBla so great as in Crypto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio that is why I am paying 10,000 HUSH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> not many would do the work for free

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Facebook isn't built with zcash protocol either. This is a protocol-level bug, not a company spying on us (tho many companies would love to use this kind of bug in secret!!!!)

Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> i know i just wanted to say that private data isn't worth anything to most people.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> they simply don't care what happens to it. Whether their IP becomes visible or not...but I like to be convinced by the opposite. I give 1000 Hush to it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> They don't want it to work for everybody

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Or be easy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Just enough so they can hide in plain sight

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If people would understand this, everything would make more sense.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SAME EXACT

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but because of the code that USES that code, it was lucky. We don't know if every zcash coin was lucky
